item.title: An electric-powered plane that can take off from your garden
item.description: Imagine an aircraft that can be powered from a wall socket, take off from the garden, and with electric engines so quiet the noise won't bother the neighbors.
item.ExtractedText: Lilium – Lilium is a new ultralight two-seater electric plane concept, designed by four German engineers. Hide Caption 1 of 15 15 photos: Vertical take-off and landing – Its swiveling ducted fan engines would allow it to take off and land vertically, requiring only 15 square meters of flat land to do so. Hide Caption 2 of 15 15 photos: Everyday aircraft – Co-owner Daniel Wiegand says, ""Our goal is to develop an aircraft for use in everyday life. We are going for a plane that does not need the complex and expensive infrastructure of an airport." Hide Caption 3 of 15 15 photos: Fair-weather flying – It's designed to only be flown in good weather conditions in daylight. It also needs uncongested airspace. Hide Caption 4 of 15 15 photos: When might it launch? – The full-size unmanned prototype is planned for later in 2016, while Lilium hopes to make the plane available for sale in 2018. Hide Caption 5 of 15 15 photos: And the price tag? – There's no price named as yet, but a release by the European Space Agency promises that it'll be "far less than similar-sized aircraft of today and with much lower running costs." Hide Caption 6 of 15 15 photos: New waves – Lilium is part of a fresh generation of design-led light aircraft shaking up an industry with new concepts -- like the Icon A5, pictured. Hide Caption 7 of 15 15 photos: Foldable seaplane – Launched last year, the Icon A5 is a two-seat, foldable seaplane. It's so compact it fits in most car garages and can be towed behind a vehicle for overland transport. Hide Caption 8 of 15 15 photos: Recreational aircraft – The Icon A5 is primarily a recreational aircraft. It can be flown by anyone with a sport pilot license. Hide Caption 9 of 15 15 photos: Costs less than a house – The Icon A5's base price of $197,000 base rises to $247,000 with additional features. The company says it has received over 1,800 orders. Hide Caption 10 of 15 15 photos: Cobalt Valkyrie-X – Currently available for pre-order, the Cobalt Valkyrie-X is a piston-engined light aircraft designed by French-born California-based entrepreneur David Loury. Hide Caption 11 of 15 15 photos: Not just a pretty design – The Valkyrie-X's main purpose is moving people over relatively long distances. It's capable of flying five people from London to most of Western Europe without refueling. Hide Caption 12 of 15 15 photos: Costs less than a much nicer house – The Cobalt Valkyrie-X starts at $699,000 -- more for extras. Cobalt is currently rolling out its first test aircraft. Hide Caption 13 of 15 15 photos: Burt Rutan's SkiGull – Inventor and aviation legend Burt Rutan has developed the SkiGull, an amphibious seaplane with retractable skis. Hide Caption 14 of 15 15 photos: Rutan's last creation? – "It will be the last time I design and build an airplane, since I want to enjoy this one for myself," says Rutan, 72. "I will explore the world with it, visiting the places you cannot easily get to any other way." Hide Caption
